importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The incident occurred on October 19, 2025, and the report was updated on that date, indicating the timeline of the event and its public disclosure.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The update time of 3:23 PM EDT on October 19, 2025, marks when the article was last revised, signaling the latest public information available about the incident.

keyTakeAways: A 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, drove into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing one person and injuring 13.
The victim who died was Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez, a 31-year-old woman from Washington.
The driver initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in to authorities.
The incident occurred in a residential neighborhood where a car was reportedly driving erratically before crashing into a tent used for a children's birthday party.
Residents, including former school board member Jocelyn Route, reported hearing loud noises, seeing emergency vehicles, and witnessing children injured or pinned under the vehicle.
The victims included six adults and eight children, aged from 1 to 17 years old; one child remains in the hospital in stable condition.
Three adult victims remain hospitalized in stable condition, one is awaiting treatment, and one has been released.
A video posted on X shows police and firefighters at the scene with the collapsed tent and emergency response efforts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A car driven by a 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, plowed into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing 31-year-old Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez and injuring 13 others, including six adults and eight children. The driver fled on foot initially but later turned himself in. Eyewitness Jocelyn Route, a former local council member, described the chaos and injuries, and a video posted on X shows the aftermath. Victims include children as young as one year old, with one child in stable condition in the hospital. Three adult victims remain hospitalized, one is awaiting treatment, and one has been released. The incident underscores serious public safety risks in residential areas and raises concerns about driver behavior and accountability.
title: Driver plows into child’s birthday party in Maryland, killing 1 and injuring 13, turns himself in
